questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

You have an Azure subscription that is linked to a hybrid Microsoft Entra tenant.

All users sync from Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS) to the tenant by using Express Settings in Microsoft Entra Connect.

You plan to implement self-service password reset (SSPR).

You need to ensure that when a user resets or changes a password, the password syncs with AD DS.

Which actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, drag the appropriate actions to the correct order. Each action may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
This is the sequence:

Select Password writeback in Microsoft Entra Connect: This step enables the core functionality of synchronizing password changes initiated through SSPR back to your on-premises AD DS.

From the Microsoft Entra admin center, configure the registration settings for SSPR: This allows users to register for SSPR by specifying their preferred contact methods (email, phone) for receiving password reset instructions.

From the Microsoft Entra admin center, configure the authentication methods for SSPR: This step defines the methods users can employ to verify their identity during the SSPR process (e.g., security questions, verification codes sent to registered methods).

Correct answer
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/authentication/tutorial-enable-cloud-sync-sspr-writeback
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/authentication/tutorial-enable-sspr

1 Password write-back in Entra Connect
2 From Entra configure On-premises integration password write-back
See https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/authentication/tutorial-enable-cloud-sync-sspr-writeback: "With password writeback enabled in Microsoft Entra Connect cloud sync, now verify, and configure Microsoft Entra self-service password reset (SSPR) for password writeback. "
3 Authentication methods in SSPR
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/authentication/tutorial-enable-sspr

Select Password writeback in Microsoft Entra Connect: This enables the functionality within Azure AD Connect to write password changes back to your on-premises AD DS. This is a fundamental step and must be done first.

From the Microsoft Entra admin center, configure on-premises integration password writeback: This configures the password writeback feature in Azure AD to work with your on-premises environment. This step sets up the communication and integration between Azure AD and your local AD DS.

From the Microsoft Entra admin center, configure the authentication methods for SSPR: This step defines how users will authenticate when resetting their passwords. This ensures the security and validity of the password reset process.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/entra/identity/authentication/concept-sspr-deploy

You plan to deploy a single device to each user. Each device will contain the Microsoft Authenticator app.

You need to ensure that the users can use their device to authenticate to both tenants by using passwordless authentication.

Which platform should you provide?

choices.C: From the Microsoft Entra admin center, select all the Microsoft Entra users, and then use the User settings blade.
choices.A: From Windows PowerShell on a domain controller, run the Get-ADUser and Set-ADUser cmdlets.
choices.D: From the Microsoft 365 admin center, select the users, and then use the Bulk actions option.
choices.B: From Azure Cloud Shell, run the Get-MgUser and Update-MgUser cmdlets.
